trans-unit.source: Install Python and the SDK - Azure
trans-unit.target: Install Python and the SDK - Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install Python and the SDK to use with Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install Python and the SDK to use with Azure.

trans-unit.source: Installing Python and the SDK
trans-unit.target: Installing Python and the SDK

trans-unit.source: Python is pretty easy to setup on Windows and comes pre-installed on Mac and Linux.
trans-unit.target: Python is pretty easy to setup on Windows and comes pre-installed on Mac and Linux.

trans-unit.source: This guide walks you through installation and getting your machine ready for use with Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide walks you through installation and getting your machine ready for use with Azure.

trans-unit.source: What's in the Python Azure SDK?
trans-unit.target: What's in the Python Azure SDK?

trans-unit.source: The Azure SDK for Python includes components that allow you to develop, deploy, and manage Python applications for Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SDK for Python includes components that allow you to develop, deploy, and manage Python applications for Azure.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, the Azure SDK for Python includes the following:
trans-unit.target: Specifically, the Azure SDK for Python includes the following:

trans-unit.source: **The Python Client Libraries for Azure**.
trans-unit.target: **The Python Client Libraries for Azure**.

trans-unit.source: These class libraries provide an interface for accessing Azure features, such as storage and service bus, and managing Azure resources, such as storage accounts, virtual machines, etc.
trans-unit.target: These class libraries provide an interface for accessing Azure features, such as storage and service bus, and managing Azure resources, such as storage accounts, virtual machines, etc.

trans-unit.source: **The Azure Emulators (Windows Only)**.
trans-unit.target: **The Azure Emulators (Windows Only)**.

trans-unit.source: The compute and storage emulators are local emulators of Cloud Services and Data Management Services that allow you to test an application locally.
trans-unit.target: The compute and storage emulators are local emulators of Cloud Services and Data Management Services that allow you to test an application locally.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Emulators run on Windows only.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Emulators run on Windows only.

trans-unit.source: Which Python and which version to use
trans-unit.target: Which Python and which version to use

trans-unit.source: There are several flavors of Python interpreters available - examples include:
trans-unit.target: There are several flavors of Python interpreters available - examples include:

trans-unit.source: CPython - the standard and most commonly used Python interpreter
trans-unit.target: CPython - the standard and most commonly used Python interpreter

trans-unit.source: IronPython - Python interpreter that runs on .Net/CLR
trans-unit.target: IronPython - Python interpreter that runs on .Net/CLR

trans-unit.source: Jython - Python interpreter that runs on the JVM
trans-unit.target: Jython - Python interpreter that runs on the JVM

trans-unit.source: Only **CPython** is tested and supported for the Python Azure SDK and Azure services such as Websites and Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: Only **CPython** is tested and supported for the Python Azure SDK and Azure services such as Websites and Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: We recommend version 2.7 or 3.4.
trans-unit.target: We recommend version 2.7 or 3.4.

trans-unit.source: Where to get Python?
trans-unit.target: Where to get Python?

trans-unit.source: There are several ways to get CPython:
trans-unit.target: There are several ways to get CPython:

trans-unit.source: Directly from [www.python.org][]
trans-unit.target: Directly from [www.python.org][]

trans-unit.source: From a reputable distro such as [www.continuum.io][], [www.enthought.com][] or [www.activestate.com][]
trans-unit.target: From a reputable distro such as [www.continuum.io][], [www.enthought.com][] or [www.activestate.com][]

trans-unit.source: Build from source!
trans-unit.target: Build from source!

trans-unit.source: Unless you have a specific need, we recommend the first two options, as described below.
trans-unit.target: Unless you have a specific need, we recommend the first two options, as described below.

trans-unit.source: Installation on Windows, Linux and MacOS (client libraries only)
trans-unit.target: Installation on Windows, Linux and MacOS (client libraries only)

trans-unit.source: If you already have Python installed, you can use pip to install a bundle of all the client libraries in your existing Python 2.7 or Python 3.3+ environment.
trans-unit.target: If you already have Python installed, you can use pip to install a bundle of all the client libraries in your existing Python 2.7 or Python 3.3+ environment.

trans-unit.source: This will download the packages from the [Python Package Index][] (PyPI).
trans-unit.target: This will download the packages from the [Python Package Index][] (PyPI).

trans-unit.source: Note that you may need to use the `sudo` command on Linux and MacOS ie.
trans-unit.target: Note that you may need to use the `sudo` command on Linux and MacOS ie.

trans-unit.source: `sudo pip install azure`.
trans-unit.target: `sudo pip install azure`.

trans-unit.source: Starting with version 1.0.0, the libraries have been separated into multiple packages.
trans-unit.target: Starting with version 1.0.0, the libraries have been separated into multiple packages.

trans-unit.source: You can now install only the packages that you need, or the bundle.
trans-unit.target: You can now install only the packages that you need, or the bundle.

trans-unit.source: To install Azure Storage Runtime client libraries:
trans-unit.target: To install Azure Storage Runtime client libraries:

trans-unit.source: To install Azure Service Bus Runtime client libraries:
trans-unit.target: To install Azure Service Bus Runtime client libraries:

trans-unit.source: To install Azure Resource Manager (ARM) client libraries:
trans-unit.target: To install Azure Resource Manager (ARM) client libraries:

trans-unit.source: To install Azure Service Management (ASM) client libraries:
trans-unit.target: To install Azure Service Management (ASM) client libraries:

trans-unit.source: Installation on Windows (Python, Azure Emulators and client libraries)
trans-unit.target: Installation on Windows (Python, Azure Emulators and client libraries)

trans-unit.source: You can use the Web Platform Installer to streamline the installation.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Web Platform Installer to streamline the installation.

trans-unit.source: These include CPython from [www.python.org][].
trans-unit.target: These include CPython from [www.python.org][].

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure SDK for Python 2.7
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure SDK for Python 2.7

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure SDK for Python 3.4
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure SDK for Python 3.4

trans-unit.source: **Note:** On Windows Server, in order to download the WebPI installer you may have to configure IE ESC settings (Start/Administrative Tools/Server Manager/Local Server, then click **IE Enhanced Security Configuration**, set to Off)
trans-unit.target: **Note:** On Windows Server, in order to download the WebPI installer you may have to configure IE ESC settings (Start/Administrative Tools/Server Manager/Local Server, then click **IE Enhanced Security Configuration**, set to Off)

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7

trans-unit.source: The WebPI installer provides everything you need to develop Python Azure apps.
trans-unit.target: The WebPI installer provides everything you need to develop Python Azure apps.

trans-unit.source: how-to-install-python-webpi-27-1
trans-unit.target: how-to-install-python-webpi-27-1

trans-unit.source: After installation is complete, type `python` at the prompt to make sure things went smoothly.
trans-unit.target: After installation is complete, type `python` at the prompt to make sure things went smoothly.

trans-unit.source: Depending on how you installed, you may need to set your "path" variable to find (the right version of) Python:
trans-unit.target: Depending on how you installed, you may need to set your "path" variable to find (the right version of) Python:

trans-unit.target: how-to-install-python-win-run-27

trans-unit.source: After the installation you should have Python and the Client Libraries available at the default location:
trans-unit.target: After the installation you should have Python and the Client Libraries available at the default location:

trans-unit.target: Python 3.4

trans-unit.source: The WebPI installer provides everything you need to develop Python Azure apps.
trans-unit.target: The WebPI installer provides everything you need to develop Python Azure apps.

trans-unit.target: how-to-install-python-webpi-34-1

trans-unit.source: Windows Uninstall
trans-unit.target: Windows Uninstall

trans-unit.source: The **Azure SDK for Python** WebPI products are not applications in the typical sense, but actually a collection of distinct products such as 32-bit Python 2.7/3.4, Azure client libraries for Python, etc. which are bundled together.
trans-unit.target: The **Azure SDK for Python** WebPI products are not applications in the typical sense, but actually a collection of distinct products such as 32-bit Python 2.7/3.4, Azure client libraries for Python, etc. which are bundled together.

trans-unit.source: A consequence of this is it has no conventional uninstaller of its own, so you will need to remove the programs that it installs individually from the Windows Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: A consequence of this is it has no conventional uninstaller of its own, so you will need to remove the programs that it installs individually from the Windows Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: If you ever wish to reinstall **Azure SDK for Python**, simply open a PowerShell command prompt as an administrator and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: If you ever wish to reinstall **Azure SDK for Python**, simply open a PowerShell command prompt as an administrator and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: and then rerun WebPI.
trans-unit.target: and then rerun WebPI.

trans-unit.source: Getting More Packages
trans-unit.target: Getting More Packages

trans-unit.source: The [Python Package Index][] (PyPI) has a rich selection of Python libraries.
trans-unit.target: The [Python Package Index][] (PyPI) has a rich selection of Python libraries.

trans-unit.source: If you chose to install a Distro, you'll already have most of the interesting bits for a variety of scenarios from web development to Technical Computing.
trans-unit.target: If you chose to install a Distro, you'll already have most of the interesting bits for a variety of scenarios from web development to Technical Computing.

trans-unit.source: Python Tools for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Python Tools for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: [Python Tools for Visual Studio][] (PTVS) is a free/OSS plugin from Microsoft which turns VS into a full-fledged Python IDE:
trans-unit.target: [Python Tools for Visual Studio][] (PTVS) is a free/OSS plugin from Microsoft which turns VS into a full-fledged Python IDE:

trans-unit.source: how-to-install-python-ptvs
trans-unit.target: how-to-install-python-ptvs

trans-unit.source: Using PTVS is optional, but is recommended as it gives you Python and Web Project/Solution support, debugging, profiling, interactive window, Template editing and Intellisense.
trans-unit.target: Using PTVS is optional, but is recommended as it gives you Python and Web Project/Solution support, debugging, profiling, interactive window, Template editing and Intellisense.

trans-unit.source: PTVS also makes it easy to deploy to Microsoft Azure, with support for deployment to [Cloud Services][] and [Websites][].
trans-unit.target: PTVS also makes it easy to deploy to Microsoft Azure, with support for deployment to [Cloud Services][] and [Websites][].

trans-unit.source: PTVS works with your existing Visual Studio 2013 or 2015 installation.
trans-unit.target: PTVS works with your existing Visual Studio 2013 or 2015 installation.

trans-unit.source: For documentation, downloads and discussions, see [Python Tools for Visual Studio].
trans-unit.target: For documentation, downloads and discussions, see [Python Tools for Visual Studio].

trans-unit.source: Python Azure Scenarios for Linux and MacOS
trans-unit.target: Python Azure Scenarios for Linux and MacOS

trans-unit.source: For Linux or MacOS, these are main Azure scenarios that are supported:
trans-unit.target: For Linux or MacOS, these are main Azure scenarios that are supported:

trans-unit.source: Consuming Azure Services by using the client libraries for Python
trans-unit.target: Consuming Azure Services by using the client libraries for Python

trans-unit.source: Running your app in a Linux VM
trans-unit.target: Running your app in a Linux VM

trans-unit.source: Developing and publishing to Azure Websites using Git
trans-unit.target: Developing and publishing to Azure Websites using Git

trans-unit.source: The first scenario enables you to author rich web apps that take advantage of the Azure PaaS capabilities such as [blob storage][], [queue storage][], [table storage][] etc. via Pythonic wrappers for the Azure REST API's.
trans-unit.target: The first scenario enables you to author rich web apps that take advantage of the Azure PaaS capabilities such as [blob storage][], [queue storage][], [table storage][] etc. via Pythonic wrappers for the Azure REST API's.

trans-unit.source: These work identically on Windows, Mac and Linux.
trans-unit.target: These work identically on Windows, Mac and Linux.

trans-unit.source: You can also use these client libraries from your local development machine or a Linux VM running on Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can also use these client libraries from your local development machine or a Linux VM running on Azure.

trans-unit.source: For the VM scenario, you simply start a Linux VM of your choice (Ubuntu, CentOS, Suse) and run/manage what you like.
trans-unit.target: For the VM scenario, you simply start a Linux VM of your choice (Ubuntu, CentOS, Suse) and run/manage what you like.

trans-unit.source: As an example, you can run [IPython][] REPL/notebook on your Windows/Mac/Linux machine and point your browser to a Linux or Windows multi-proc VM running the IPython Engine on Azure.
trans-unit.target: As an example, you can run [IPython][] REPL/notebook on your Windows/Mac/Linux machine and point your browser to a Linux or Windows multi-proc VM running the IPython Engine on Azure.

trans-unit.source: See the [IPython Notebook on Azure][] tutorial for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the [IPython Notebook on Azure][] tutorial for more information.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to setup a Linux VM, please see the [Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to setup a Linux VM, please see the [Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Using Git deployment, you can develop a Python web application and publish it to an Azure Website from any operating system.
trans-unit.target: Using Git deployment, you can develop a Python web application and publish it to an Azure Website from any operating system.

trans-unit.source: When you push your repository to Azure, it will automatically create a virtual environment and pip install your required packages.
trans-unit.target: When you push your repository to Azure, it will automatically create a virtual environment and pip install your required packages.

trans-unit.source: For more information on developing and publishing Azure Websites, see the tutorials for [Creating Websites with Django][], [Creating Websites with Bottle][] and [Creating Websites with Flask][].
trans-unit.target: For more information on developing and publishing Azure Websites, see the tutorials for [Creating Websites with Django][], [Creating Websites with Bottle][] and [Creating Websites with Flask][].

trans-unit.source: For more general information on using any WSGI compliant framework, see [Configuring Python with Azure Websites][].
trans-unit.target: For more general information on using any WSGI compliant framework, see [Configuring Python with Azure Websites][].
